main event: On 3rd March 1956, a ground-visual observation was made 7 miles from Andrews AFB of a single white fluorescent-like light resembling a pen at arm's length, climbing and turning slowly with an estimated speed of 700 knots.
interesting points: The light faded and increased in intensity regularly but did not blink.
It was concluded to probably be a balloon or aircraft.
The sighting took place in close proximity to a major air force base.
